overview:
Social media / communications guy, journalist, editor, writer, author, website producer, Web 2.0 specialist, co-founder, Brit.

John Carson started his journalism career in the U.K. in 1995 as a reporter on Streetwise Business Magazine, covering small business and franchising. He went on to edit Product & Image Security, a publication dealing with counterfeit products, security inks and identity theft.

In 2000 he moved to Canada, and worked at Rogers Media Publishing as a senior online content manager for a stable of around 22 trade publications. His role was to create content and e-newsletters to drive traffic to the websites.

He went on to edit Silicon Valley NORTH, a national technology publication, and was also responsible for re-launching the website and creating an e-newsletter.

That was followed by a stint as managing editor of Beer.com, a menâ€™s lifestyle website. He created content, e-newsletters, a blog and podcast.

The next role was as acting communications manager at Upper Canada College, one of North Americaâ€™s most prestigious private boysâ€™ schools. He created website content, including news articles and an e-newsletter, and also edited Old Times, the alumni publication.

He is now a social media / PR consultant.
